requirements.summary: Add public Blogs routes and pages for listing blog posts and viewing a single blog post by id with loading/empty/error states.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to `/blogs` shows a blog list UI that loads from the backend and handles loading and empty states.
Navigating to `/blogs/<id>` shows a detail view for that blog post (title + content) and handles missing ids (not found state).
Routes are wired into `frontend/src/App.tsx` using the existing TanStack Router pattern used for `/articles`, `/research`, etc.

file_operations.description: Create `BlogsPage` to render a public list of blog posts using the Blogs React Query hook, including loading state, empty state, and a list UI that navigates to `/blogs/$id` for an item. Use composed shadcn/ui components (e.g., Card) and lucide icons as needed; do not modify any `frontend/src/components/ui/*` files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create blog detail page for route `/blogs/$id` that reads the route param, fetches the blog post by id via the single-blog query hook, and renders title + content with appropriate loading, error, and not-found states (including invalid id parsing). Use composed shadcn/ui components as needed; do not modify any `frontend/src/components/ui/*` files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register TanStack Router routes for `/blogs` and `/blogs/$id` alongside existing routes, importing and wiring `BlogsPage` and `BlogDetailPage` into the routeTree so the pages are navigable.

requirements.summary: Add a top-level "Blogs" navigation item in the global Header for both desktop and mobile menus with correct active-route styling for `/blogs` and `/blogs/$id`.
acceptanceCriteria: Header shows a "Blogs" nav item alongside existing items (Home, Learn Finance, Glossary, Articles, etc.).
The mobile sheet navigation also includes "Blogs".
Active-route styling works consistently when the current path is `/blogs` or a blog detail route.

file_operations.description: Add a new nav item `{ label: 'Blogs', path: '/blogs' }` to the top-level navigation used for both desktop and mobile menus. Update active-route logic so the Blogs item is treated as active when `currentPath` starts with `/blogs` (covering both `/blogs` and `/blogs/$id`), while preserving existing behavior for other items and calculator highlighting. Use composed shadcn/ui components only; do not modify any `frontend/src/components/ui/*` files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add React Query hooks for fetching blog lists and individual blog posts by id, following existing actor-gated query patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: A query hook exists to fetch the blog list from the backend and is used by `/blogs`.
A query hook exists to fetch a single blog post by id and is used by `/blogs/$id`.
Hooks are disabled until the backend actor is available, consistent with existing hooks.

file_operations.description: Add Blogs query hooks that call backend actor methods exposed in `frontend/src/backend.d.ts`: (1) a list hook that fetches public blogs (ensure unpublished are excluded for public UI), and (2) a detail hook that fetches a single blog post by id. Follow existing patterns: return safe defaults when actor is unavailable and set `enabled: !!actor && !isFetching` (and also guard by presence/validity of id for the detail hook).
Wire `BlogsPage` to use the newly added blog list query hook from `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts`, ensuring the hook drives loading/empty states and the displayed list.
Wire `BlogDetailPage` to use the newly added single-blog query hook from `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts`, ensuring the hook drives loading/error/not-found states and the rendered blog content.
